node.title: Uganda rocked by two explosions, killing two people, injuring 24 in Kampala
node.alt: A modern city skyline on hazy day with red roofs in the foreground
node.description: Local television station NTV Uganda reports two explosions — one very close to parliament and one near the central police station — with four people critically injured.
node.content: ["Two explosions in the centre of Uganda's capital city Kampala have killed at least two people and set several cars on fire, local television reported.", "At least 24 people were hospitalised with injuries sustained in the blasts on Tuesday, Emmanuel Ainebyoona, a spokesman for the Ministry of Health, said in a Twitter post.\u00a0", "Four of the victims\u00a0are critically injured, he said.", "NTV Uganda said there had been two explosions \u2014 one very close to parliament and one near the central police station.", "Parliament had\u00a0been\u00a0evacuated, the television station reported.", "The cause of the blasts was not immediately clear, but videos posted on social media showed plumes of smoke coming from the city centre.", "\"First responders included Red Cross personnel who were using fire extinguishers to curb the fire on Parliamentary Avenue,\" the station said on Twitter.", "A Ugandan military spokesperson, Brigadier Flavia Byekwaso, said there had been \"multiple\" blasts and \"multiple\" casualties but declined to give further details.", "Irene Nakasiita, a spokesperson at the Uganda Red Cross, said they would release information about the blasts later.", "Ugandan soldiers are fighting al Qaeda-linked al Shabaab insurgents in Somalia as part of an African Union peacekeeping force.", "Al Shabaab has carried out several deadly bombings in Uganda.", "Last month, Islamic State made its first claim of responsibility for a blast in Uganda. That bomb \u2014 packed with shrapnel \u2014 killed a waitress at a restaurant.", "Also last month, Ugandan police said a suicide bomber had exploded on a bus, killing himself and injuring others.", "ABC/wires"]
